software.name: Matlab
software.overview: MATLAB is a high-performance language for technical computing. It integrates computation, visualization, and programming in an easy-to-use environment where problems and solutions are expressed in familiar mathematical notation.
software.core_features: Mathematical functions, data visualization, algorithm development, modeling and simulation, application development.

software.name: GCC
software.overview: The GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) is a compiler system produced by the GNU Project supporting various programming languages.
software.core_features: Supports several programming languages, optimizations, various platforms, and strong community support.

software.name: NumPy
software.overview: NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. It contains among other things a powerful N-dimensional array object, linear algebra functions, Fourier transforms, and tools for integrating with other low-level languages.
software.core_features: N-dimensional array objects, linear algebra operations, Fourier transforms, random number capabilities, and integration with C/C++ and Fortran code.

software.name: GROMACS
software.overview: GROMACS is a versatile package to perform molecular dynamics simulations, which include a wide range of features.
software.core_features: Molecular dynamics simulations, energy minimization, trajectory analysis, parallel computing support.

software.name: PyTorch
software.overview: PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library for Python, based on Torch, used for applications such as natural language processing.
software.core_features: Tensor computation, dynamic computation graphs, deep neural networks, GPU acceleration.
